Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create the first face with the following curves and loops: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.28, 0.0]. - Arc 1: Starting at [0.28, 0.0], with a midpoint at [0.316, 0.0149], and ending at [0.3309, 0.0509]. - Line 2: Starting at [0.3309, 0.0509] and ending at [0.3309, 0.4862]. - Line 3: Starting at [0.3309, 0.4862] and ending at [0.0166, 0.75]. - Line 4: Starting at [0.0166, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.7302]. - Line 5: Starting at [0.0, 0.7302] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. The loop is closed and forms the front face of the prism. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Perform a 3D transformation using euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the sketch by 0.0143 units in the positive normal direction and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and the front face is angled at 45 degrees. The dimensions are 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.0143 (length, width, height).</description>
